title: 96/675/EC: Commission Decision of 25 November 1996 laying down special conditions for the import of live bivalve molluscs, echinoderms, tunicates and marine gastropods originating in Chile (Text with EEA relevance)
header:
COMMISSION DECISION of 25 November 1996 laying down special conditions for the import of live bivalve molluscs, echinoderms, tunicates and marine gastropods originating in Chile (Text with EEA relevance) (96/675/EC)
THE COMMISSION OF THE EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES
main_body: The 'Servicio Nacional de Pesca (Sernapesca)` shall be the competent authority in Chile for verifying and certifying that live bivalve molluscs, echinoderms, tunicates and marine gastropods fulfil the requirements of Directive 91/492/EEC.

Frozen or processed bivalve molluscs, echinoderms, tunicates and marine gastropods originating in Chile and intended for human consumption must originate in the authorized production areas listed in the Annex hereto.
This Decisions is addressed to the Member States.
attachments:
